body:
Yeah, that worked. I assume you meant something like this:
```c++
REGISTER_OP("MaxPool3DGrad")
    .Input("orig_input: Tinput")
    .Input("orig_output: Tinput")
    .Input("grad: T")
    .Output("output: T")
    .Attr("T: numbertype = DT_FLOAT")
    .Attr("Tinput: numbertype = DT_FLOAT");
```
Compatibility test passes now but I assume that original definition contained mistake. Do we want to preserve backward compatibility for this op?

body_text:
Yeah, that worked. I assume you meant something like this:
REGISTER_OP("MaxPool3DGrad")
    .Input("orig_input: Tinput")
    .Input("orig_output: Tinput")
    .Input("grad: T")
    .Output("output: T")
    .Attr("T: numbertype = DT_FLOAT")
    .Attr("Tinput: numbertype = DT_FLOAT");
